Package jgame

The JGame package contains everything related to the JGame game library.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Context
    The context for a controller or listener on a given object.
    GAnimatable
    Any animated object that can go to the next and previous frames.
    GObjectHolder
    An object that can hold other GObjects.
    GPaintable
    Any object that can be painted in a game.
    GSprite.Primitive
    A primitive representation for a sprite.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BaseGame
    The main game class for GameLibrary games.
    BaseGame.InstanceList<T extends GPaintable>
    A list of instances of a class.
    Game
    The desktop Swing implementation of the GameLibrary game.
    GameApplet
    The web applet implementation of the GameLibrary game.
    GButton
    A simple button that uses GSprites, animated or static, for each button state defined in ButtonListener.State.
    GContainer
    A simple container.
    GMessage
    A simple text message in a game.
    GObject
    A standard game object.
    GParallax
    A parallax layer pane.
    GParallax.GTiledSprite
    A tiled sprite container that facilitates autotile scroloing.
    GParallax.GTiledSprite.ScrollController
    A controller that allows scrolling of a tiled instance, with automatic resets when the object's position leaves its origin bounding box.
    GRootContainer
    The root container for a game.
    GSprite
    An object whose display and bounding box are determined by an image, or multiple images for an animation.
    ImageCache
    A cache for images in a game.
    SoundManager
    A cache for sounds.
    SoundManager.Sound
    A sound reference that can be stopped by the user.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    ButtonState
    The possible states of a button.
    GSprite.PrimitiveShape
    A collection of basic primitive shapes.

Package jgame Description

The JGame package contains everything related to the JGame game library. The atomic JGame object class is GObject, while the main class for Swing-targeted JGame applications is Game. JGame applications can run with (very) minimal modifications by using the GameApplet class as well. Under the hood, JGame uses Swing for painting, but novice developers don't need to worry about that: importing images from files or using simple painting operations are possible with the simplicity of the JGame elements, which are bridged with Swing in the BaseGame class.
Since:
1.0
Author:
William Chargin
